title: Inspired and Prosperous: 11 World-renowned Coaches Reveal Their Success and Sustainability Secrets: 11 World-renowned Coaches Reveal Their Success and Sustainability Secrets
features: Inspired and Prosperous is your access to the priceless secrets and usable real-world insights of the industry's elite coaches who started their coaching businesses from scratch, thrive even amidst tough economic times, and collectively offer you 208 years of proven know-how and best practices.
Your Coaching Business Can Thrive In Any Economy

•A life, business or executive coach who wants been-there insights into the grit of why and what you need to do to craft a prosperous coaching business that is sustainable•A trained coach who is contemplating taking on credentialing and wondering if you really need it•Passionate about uncovering marketing strategies that repeatedly work and those that don’t•Determined to seek clarity amidst the coaching versus consulting controversy
…Inspired and Prosperous is the book for you.

Meet 11 accomplished coaches who have each been in business from 12 to 32 years as they share their raw, powerfully inspirational, tell-it-like-it-is mistakes and triumphs. Immerse in meaningful and at times unexpected conversations of how they made it through hard times, and receive their gift of “You can do it” encouragement.
Curious about who the coaches are?

•Laura Berman Fortgang has been on The Oprah Winfrey Show. She has also written five books, three of which were national bestsellers•Ken Kesslin, Margie Heiler and Pat Williams travel to countries like Turkey, Singapore and Kenya to coach•Pat Williams started and sold his own coach training school•Donna Karlin coaches high-level politicians in America and Canada•David Goldsmith was Thomas Leonard’s (founder of professional one-to-one coaching) coach•Jay Perry came back from the brink of failure and was featured as one of Success magazine’s comeback entrepreneurs of the year•Molly Gordon's e-newsletter was one of the first to be published in the industry, and it continues to be a sought-after resource•Lola White built a brand new retreat and training facility known as Goddess Cottage in actress Meryl Streep's neighborhood•Suzi Pomerantz was named a SupporTED Coaching Hero for coaching the world-changers in TED•Lloyd Raines is on the founding faculty of Georgetown University's executive coaching program -- one of the first to be offered by a college
Thousands of coaches have had business breakthroughs thanks to the expert coaches in this book. Buy it now and let them start inspiring and assisting you too.
description: Author, Duanna Pang-Dokland, CC, is a certified coach and owner of Igniting Possibility Coaching (ignitingpossibility.com), an international coaching and consulting practice that assists coaches, corporate executives and business owners to cultivate inspired and prosperous businesses. A past International Coach Federation chapter president, Duanna was a widely published magazine editor and writer (for publications like Marie Claire) before she moved from Singapore to America, found her sacred calling as a coach, and started her business without knowing a single soul apart from her family. While others may perceive this as a risk-infused leap, Duanna is gratefully delighting in the opportunity to coach organizations that range from the Children's Hospital of Alabama to small businesses in Singapore.

author: {'avatar': 'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51tkW4g9d+L._SY600_.jpg', 'name': 'Duanna Pang-Dokland', 'about': ['Duanna Pang-Dokland is a Certified Coach whose practice, Igniting Possibility Coaching (http://ignitingpossibility.com), works with corporate executives, business owners and professional coaches to design and sustain inspired and prosperous businesses they love. She started her coaching business without knowing a single soul when she moved from Singapore to America.', "Today, her clients include hospitals like Children's Hospital of Alabama, the Federal Reserve Bank, IT consultancies, manufacturing businesses, solo entrepreneurs, as well as non-profits like the American Red Cross.", 'In her past life, Duanna was a magazine editor and writer, having been published in several lifestyle magazines, including Marie Claire (Singapore and Malaysia Editions). Since then, she has also been published in the Birmingham Business Journal, The Birmingham News, Action Community for Entrepreneurship, Asia Pacific Tech Monitor, and the blogs of the International Coach Federation and International Association of Coaches.', "A Past President of the International Coach Federation's Alabama Chapter, Duanna is a Board Member of Coaching the Global Village, a non-profit that teaches leadership skills to Third World communities around the world.", 'Duanna dabbles in oil painting, enjoys traveling and is amazed that to date she has visited over 150 cities around the world.']}
